info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 5:57AM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WESTERN CALLAHAN...NORTHWESTERN COLEMAN...EASTERN TAYLOR AND NORTHEASTERN RUNNELS COUNTIES THROUGH 630 AM CST... At 556 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hamby to Lawn to near Winters. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Abilene, Clyde, Winters, Baird, Tuscola, Lawn, Novice, Eula, Dudley, Potosi, Bradshaw, Crews, Oplin, Lake Coleman, Ovalo, Goldsboro, Lake Winters Lake, and Kirby Lake. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 287 and 306. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in San Angelo.
